title.value: A portrait of the different configurations between digitally-enabled innovations and climate governance
title.justification: The title explicitly mentions the exploration of configurations between digital innovations and climate governance, which is the core focus of the paper.
title.quote: A portrait of the different configurations between digitally-enabled innovations and climate governance

extractions.description: The paper explores how digitally-enabled initiatives can reshape climate governance. It presents a database of various initiatives around the world that utilize digital technologies for climate action. The authors propose four strategies these initiatives employ, analyzed through the Earth System Governance framework's '5 A's': Architecture, Agency, Adaptiveness, Accountability, and Allocation & Access.

type.justification: The paper presents a database of real-world digitally-enabled climate initiatives and analyzes them, indicating an empirical study based on data and observation.
type.quote: In this paper, we employ the term ‘governance’ as the well-established definition of earth-system governance...

name.justification: The paper's focus is on leveraging digital technologies to transform and re-imagine climate governance, aligning with the field of Climate Governance.
name.quote: The goal of this paper is to spark discussions and further investigations into how digitally-enabled initiatives may actually re-shape climate governance.

name.justification: The paper discusses the role of digital technologies in climate governance, which places it within the field of Digital Innovations.
name.quote: A proliferation of climate action leveraging digital technol­ogies has emerged...

name.justification: Applications of machine learning in climate-related sectors such as energy, transport, and agriculture are discussed.
name.quote: The application of machine learning, a subset of artificial intelligence (AI; algorithms that automate human processes), has been recorded across a diverse range of sectors including energy, transport, agriculture...

name.justification: The paper mentions the use of AI and machine learning models for various climate-related applications, signifying their role in this research context.
name.quote: The application of machine learning...has been recorded across a diverse range of sectors including energy, transport, agriculture, industry, and geoengineering.

is_contributed.justification: The paper does not contribute a new AI or Machine Learning model but discusses existing applications of these models in climate governance.
is_contributed.quote: The application of machine learning...has been recorded across a diverse range of sectors including energy, transport, agriculture, industry, and geoengineering.

is_executed.justification: The paper discusses the execution of AI and machine learning models in different sectors, implying they are operational and implemented.
is_executed.quote: By using statistical models and algorithms to analyse data, including large datasets...

is_compared.justification: The paper does not compare AI or ML models with other models in a numerical or performance-based context.
is_compared.quote: The paper discusses the role and application of machine learning in various sectors without numerical comparisons.

referenced_paper_title.value: Tackling Climate Change with Machine Learning
referenced_paper_title.justification: This reference seems to align with the discussion on machine learning applications for climate change, as mentioned in the paper.
